{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3163135,"name":"Landon","username":"Lfehr","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/l/47e85d/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-13T01:32:29.947Z","cooked":"

What gyro would you recommend to use. We currently use an anolog devices first choice gyro but it broke and now if you start auto it makes the angle go to 70,000 and then it will flip to -70000. It should be between-25 and 25.

  • Navx
  • Pigeon
  • Other put in the comments

0 voters

Add in the comments why you like it and the pros and cons you have found please.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-03-13T02:44:39.031Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":185,"readers_count":184,"score":42.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":429998,"topic_slug":"gyro-of-choice","display_username":"Landon","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53962,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/gyro-of-choice/429998/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3163199,"name":"David Lame","username":"David_Lame","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/51bf81/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-13T03:01:00.662Z","cooked":"

I’ve never plugged in a Pigeon. I wouldn’t have known it existed if I hadn’t seen it mentioned in threads on Chief Delphi.

What I can say is that we’ve run field centric drive on Meccanum and, this year, swerve drive, and never had a NavX related problem. Possibly we aren’t asking for as much precision as other teams, but at the end of the match, we can still balance on the charging station using field centric drive.

So, in summary, I can’t say whether the Pigeon is better, but if Pigeon is out of stock and NavX is in stock, I would recommend NavX.

We potentially (because I don’t like to speak in absolutes) got knocked out of our first event in 2022 prematurely due to our NavX failing on us. Switched to Pigeon for the rest of our season, had zero gyro problems that couldn’t be fixed with a quick re-zero since. Highly recommend Pigeon.

We ran with a navX2 this year and haven’t had any issues at all, and I didn’t notice any yaw drift whatsoever (with field relative swerve). Just make sure to screw the navX into the rio properly. We also had a Pigeon on a test swerve bot for a few months and never had any issues, though it never saw a real field.

NavX2-MXP has been working great for us this season. We had the ADIS16470 IMU earlier on but couldn’t get good pitch/roll data from the WPILib library for it for auto balance which is why we switched.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-03-13T04:39:38.750Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":118,"readers_count":117,"score":23.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":429998,"topic_slug":"gyro-of-choice","display_username":"Christopher149","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14984,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC857 lead mentor / FTC10723+13284+15270 lead mentor"},"post_url":"/t/gyro-of-choice/429998/9","custom_user_title":"FRC857 lead mentor / FTC10723+13284+15270 lead mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3163971,"name":"David Lame","username":"David_Lame","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/51bf81/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-13T22:40:55.157Z","cooked":"
Lfehr:

How does the NavX connect to the Robo Rio and how hard is it to program ?

The most common way to connect the NavX is to plug it into the MXP port (that row of two connectors in the middle of the RoboRio. No wiring required.

The second most common way to connect the NavX is to use a USB cable. No “real” wiring required.

As for programming, it seems pretty easy to me. Like almost everything in programming, it’s super simple…as soon as you figure out how to do it.

Basically:

AHRS myNavX=new AHRS(); //Will use MXP port;
double yawInDegrees=myNavX.getYaw();

But…there are a couple of gotchas.

It’s easiest to use if it’s mounted parallel to the ground. It has an automatic calibration routine to detect which direction is “down”, but you have to be careful about that. It uses the standard convention of yaw being positive clockwise, which is opposite the standard convention FIRST uses in the WPILIB swerve classes. It tries to make things easy for you when it comes to coordinate systems and compensating for detection of mounting in directions other than parallel to the ground. If you get one, and it isn’t working, don’t give up. It really is simple, so if it isn’t working, there is probable something wrong with the power or the orientation isn’t what you think it is.

One other thing I have found is that it takes a few seconds to initialize, so a few seconds of pause between the time you call “new”, and the time you do anything can’t hurt.

As for the Pigeon, the collective wisdom of Chief Delphi is that it’s better. Based on that, I strongly suspect it is, indeed, better, but I don’t have any experience with it, and the NavX has worked so well for us that I’m not tempted to switch. More importantly, if the Pigeon is out of stock, I’m confident the NavX is good enough.
